title: AnthropogenicGeomorphologicFeature
description: An anthropogenic geomorphologic feature is a geomorphologic feature (i.e., landform) which has been created by human activity.  For example, a dredged channel, midden, open pit or reclaimed land.

unitDescription-1.title: unitDescription
unitDescription-1.description: The unitDescription property is an association that links the geomorphologic feature to a geologic description (e.g., related stratigraphic units and earth materials).

unitDescription-2.title: unitDescription
unitDescription-2.description: The unitDescription property is an association that links the geomorphologic feature to a geologic description (e.g., related stratigraphic units and earth materials).

anthropogenicGeomorphologicFeatureType.title: anthropogenicGeomorphologicFeatureType
anthropogenicGeomorphologicFeatureType.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">anthropogenicGeomorphologicFeatureType: AnthropogenicGeomorphologicFeatureTypeTerm</font> is a reference from a controlled vocabulary describing the type of geomorphologic feature.
